Package edu.uky.cs.nil.sabre.logic

Class Arithmetic.Operator

java.lang.Object
edu.uky.cs.nil.sabre.logic.Arithmetic.Operator
All Implemented Interfaces:
Unique, Serializable, Comparable<Arithmetic.Operator>
Enclosing class:
Arithmetic
public abstract static class Arithmetic.Operator extends Object implements Comparable<Arithmetic.Operator>, Serializable, Unique
An arithmetic operator is a singleton object that specifies how to combine two numeric input values into a numeric output value.
Author:
Stephen G. Ware
See Also:

    calculate(Number left, Number right)

    If an arithmetic expression using this operator and the given left and right values can be simplified (for example, if the left and right values are both values), this method returns the simplified expression.

  • Method Details

    • compareTo

      public int compareTo(Arithmetic.Operator other)
      Specified by:
      compareTo in interface Comparable<Arithmetic.Operator>

    • calculate

      public Value calculate(Value left, Value right)
      Returns the result of applying this operator to two input values. If both values are numbers, this method calls calculate(Number, Number), otherwise this method returns unknown.
      Parameters:
      left - the value on the left of the arithmetic operator
      right - the value on the right of the arithmetic operator
      Returns:
      the result of applying the arithmetic operation to the values

    • calculate

      protected abstract Number calculate(Number left, Number right)
      This method is called from calculate(Value, Value) when both values are numbers and returns the result of applying this operator to two numbers.
      Parameters:
      left - the number on the left of the arithmetic operator
      right - the number on the right of the arithmetic operator
      Returns:
      the result of applying the arithmetic operation to the numbers

    • simplify

      public Expression simplify(Expression left, Expression right)
      If an arithmetic expression using this operator and the given left and right values can be simplified (for example, if the left and right values are both values), this method returns the simplified expression. Otherwise, this method returns null.
      Parameters:
      left - the left side of an arithmetic expression using this operator
      right - the right side of an arithmetic expression using this operator
      Returns:
      a simplified logical expression or null if the expression cannot be simplified

    • isolate

      protected Expression isolate(Fluent query, Expression left, Expression right, Comparison.Operator inequality, Expression rhs)
      Isolates a query fluent on the left side of a comparison which has an arithmetic expression using this operator on its left.
      Parameters:
      query - the fluent that should be isolated
      left - the left side of the arithmetic expression which appears on the left side of the comparison
      right - the right side of the arithmetic expression which appear on the left side of the comparison
      inequality - the comparison operator used in the comparison
      rhs - the right side of the comparison
      Returns:
      a comparison with the flight as its left side
